pr_title: Enhance TableRebalancer to be able to rebalance table under any condition

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be error level.
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText:
I think  a warning is better. The server instance, when it transitioned into ERROR state, would have logged an error anyway. It is not an error in the controller if it discovers that a server was malfunctioning.
On another (but related) note, I would avoid logging strings that have "ERROR". It is quite irritating to see these come up when we see some problem, and want to get all the error logs (as in, logs that have been logged with LOGGER.error() statement). I am not sure we can do much here, but something to note.
replies.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: Can you elaborate on what instance re-assignment means? Maybe best to add it in the comments on RebalanceConfigConstants. We need to also doc it in along with the rebalance command. Let me know if there is a doc already, and I can read it.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: More comments can be found in the instance assignment related classes. The doc for instance assignment has not been added yet, will do in the following pr.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: I prefer having a : before the variables so it is easier to locate the variables
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText:
(1) If the table is disabled, it is already down, so maybe just say that we are moving segment assignment?
(2) Why is this a warning? it can be an info.
(3) We should return this information in the status as well.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText:
(1) rebalance with downtime is the same as moving segment assignment (added javadoc)
(2) It is a warning because we log it only when downtime is set to false
(3) Added downtime info into the response
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Is is useful to extract this part into a method (provided it has reasonable number of arguments. Similarly the else part.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Too many arguments need to be passed, and it is called only once, so prefer keeping it inline for now
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Should we be passing the expected version into waitForExternalViewToConverge so that if the idealstate changes due to some other factor, we don't wait for convergence. Instead, we should execute the logic below.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: We still need to wait for convergence when ideal state changes to guarantee the available replicas

timeline.message:
Enhance TableRebalancer to be able to rebalance table under any condition

Add a new option: "bestEfforts" to allow rebalance in the following scenario (min available replicas won't be guaranteed)
- Table with segments in ERROR state
- ExternalView not converged within the max wait time

Also add support for rebalancing Helix disabled table with downtime
